Class Player

java.lang.Object
player.Player
Direct Known Subclasses:
AI, Human
public abstract class Player extends Object
Represents an abstract player in the Jest card game. This class provides the core functionality for both human and AI players, including card management, turn execution, and game interactions.

Concrete implementations must provide the makeChoice(int, int, ArrayList, boolean) method to define how the player makes decisions during the game.

See Also:
  • Human
  • AI

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(String name)
      Constructs a new Player with the specified name. Initializes the player with an empty jest pile and a 2-card offer array.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the player

  • Method Details

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the player's current state. Displays the player's name, jest pile contents, and current offers.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a formatted string showing the player's name, jest cards, and offer cards

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Gets the name of the player.
      Returns:
      the player's name

    • setName

      public void setName(String name)
      Sets the name of the player.
      Parameters:
      name - the new name for the player

    • getJest

      public ArrayList<Card> getJest()
      Gets the player's jest pile (collection of scored cards).
      Returns:
      an ArrayList containing the cards in the player's jest pile

    • setJest

      public void setJest(ArrayList<Card> jest)
      Sets the player's jest pile.
      Parameters:
      jest - the new jest pile to set

    • getOffer

      public Card[] getOffer()
      Gets the player's current offer array.
      Returns:
      an array containing the visible card (index 0) and hidden card (index 1)

    • setOffer

      public void setOffer(Card visibleCard, Card hiddenCard)
      Sets both the visible and hidden cards in the player's offer. The hidden card's visibility is automatically set to false.
      Parameters:
      visibleCard - the card to be visible to other players
      hiddenCard - the card to be hidden from other players

    • setVisibleCard

      public void setVisibleCard(Card visibleCard)
      Sets the visible card in the player's offer (index 0).
      Parameters:
      visibleCard - the card to be visible to other players

    • setHiddenCard

      public void setHiddenCard(Card hiddenCard)
      Sets the hidden card in the player's offer (index 1). The card's visibility is automatically set to false.
      Parameters:
      hiddenCard - the card to be hidden from other players

    • pickCard

      public void pickCard(Card card, Player pickedPlayer)
      Picks a card from another player's offer and adds it to this player's jest pile. Removes the card from the picked player's offer and displays a message.
      Parameters:
      card - the card being picked
      pickedPlayer - the player from whom the card is being picked

    • addLastCardToJest

      public void addLastCardToJest()
      Adds the last remaining card from the player's offer to their jest pile. This is typically called at the end of a round when one card remains. If two cards are still in the offer, an error message is displayed.

    • getVisibleCard

      public Card getVisibleCard()
      Gets the visible card from the player's offer.
      Returns:
      the visible card (index 0 of the offer array)

    • getHiddenCard

      public Card getHiddenCard()
      Gets the hidden card from the player's offer.
      Returns:
      the hidden card (index 1 of the offer array)

    • removeLastCardFromOffer

      public Card removeLastCardFromOffer()
      Removes and returns the last remaining card from the player's offer. Checks both positions and removes whichever card exists.
      Returns:
      the card that was removed from the offer, or null if no card exists

    • hasJokerCard

      public boolean hasJokerCard()
      Checks if the player has at least one Joker card in their jest pile.
      Returns:
      true if the player has a Joker card, false otherwise

    • AddCardToJest

      public void AddCardToJest(Card card)
      Adds a card directly to the player's jest pile.
      Parameters:
      card - the card to add to the jest pile

    • playTurn

      public Player playTurn(Game game)
      Executes the player's turn in the game. Displays available cards from other players, prompts for a card choice, and determines the next player based on whose card was picked.

      Turn flow:

      1. Display all available cards from opponents
      2. If no opponent cards available, allow picking own cards
      3. Player makes a choice via makeChoice(int, int, ArrayList, boolean)
      4. Pick the selected card and update game state
      5. Determine the next player based on whose card was picked
      Parameters:
      game - the current game instance
      Returns:
      the next player to take a turn, or null if the round should end

    • makeChoice

      public abstract int makeChoice(int min, int max, ArrayList<Card> cards, boolean isHidingCard)
      Abstract method for making choices during the game. Concrete implementations (Human, AI) must define how decisions are made.
      Parameters:
      min - the minimum valid choice value (inclusive)
      max - the maximum valid choice value (inclusive)
      cards - the list of cards available for the decision
      isHidingCard - true if choosing which card to hide, false if choosing which card to pick
      Returns:
      the chosen option (typically 1-indexed)

    • chooseCardToHide

      public void chooseCardToHide(Card card1, Card card2)
      Prompts the player to choose which of two cards to hide in their offer. Displays both cards and sets one as visible and the other as hidden based on the choice.

      Special case: If only one card is provided (card2 is null), that card is automatically set as visible with no hidden card.

      Parameters:
      card1 - the first card option
      card2 - the second card option (can be null)
